Race.SpecificTitle: Fairwood Crime Prevention and Imp. Dist. -- $40/$200 Parcel Fee - BOC - 15 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText: Fairwood Crime Prevention and Improvement District Proposition
Race.FullText: Shall Fairwood Crime Prevention and Improvement District (the "District"), be authorized to levy and collect an annual parcel fee of $40 on each residential parcel and $200 on each commercial parcel in the District for 15 years beginning in 2020 and ending in 2034 for the purpose of aiding in crime prevention, enhancing security, providing for an increase in security patrols and promoting and encouraging the beautification and overall betterment of the District including improving lighting and signage, which fee may be increased each subsequent calendar year not to exceed 10% of the fee imposed during the previous calendar year and not to exceed $100 for residential parcels and $500 for commercial parcels pursuant to Act No. 329 (2019) enacting La. R.S. 33:9097.30, (the estimated collection for the initial levy is $28,600)?

Race.SpecificTitle: Hermitage-Cross Creek Crime Prev. and Dev. Dist. -- $100 Parcel Fee - BOC - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText: Hermitage-Cross Creek Crime Prevention and Development District Proposition
Race.FullText: Shall the Hermitage-Cross Creek Crime Prevention and Development District (the "District"), acting through the Board of Commissioners of the District and the East Baton Rouge Parish Metropolitan Council, be authorized to levy and collect an annual fee on each improved parcel of land located within the boundaries of the District in the amount of One Hundred Dollars ($100.00) for a residential structure, which fee shall be levied for a period of ten (10) years, commencing on January 1, 2020 (an estimated $56,625.00 expected at the time to be collected from the levy of the service charge for the entire year) and which fee shall be collected by any means authorized by law for the collection of taxes, all as provided in La. R.S. 33:9097.6, with the proceeds of said fee (after deducting the reasonable and necessary costs of collecting said fee) to be used to aid in crime prevention and enhance security of District residents by providing for an increase of law enforcement personnel or contracted security personnel in the District and for other purposes permitted by applicable law?

Race.SpecificTitle: Monticello Crime Prev. and Imp. Dist. -- $100 Parcel Fee - BOC - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText: Monticello Crime Prevention and Improvement District Proposition
Race.FullText: Shall the Monticello Crime Prevention and Improvement District (the "District"), acting through the Board of Commissioners of the District and the East Baton Rouge Parish Metropolitan Council, be authorized to levy and collect an annual fee on each improved parcel of land located within the boundaries of the District in the amount of One Hundred Dollars ($100.00) for a residential structure, which fee shall be levied for a period of ten (10) years, commencing on January 1, 2020 (an estimated $87,500 expected at the time to be collected from the levy of the parcel fee for the entire year) and which fee shall be collected by any means authorized by law for the collection of taxes, all as provided in La. R.S. 33:9097.30, with the proceeds of said fee (after deducting the reasonable and necessary costs of collecting said fee) to be used to aid in crime prevention and enhance security of District residents by providing for an increase of law enforcement personnel or contracted security personnel in the District and for other purposes permitted by applicable law?
